title: News View :: The World On Arirang
text: President Moon Jae-in has called for the international community's support for South Korea's historic challenge to establish denuclearization and lasting peace on the Korean Peninsula."South Korea has taken on the challenge of creating historic change through denuclearization and permanent peace on the Korean Peninsula. We are facing the final wall. Only by going over it can we prevent a return to the days of conflict and enter a bright future. Efforts by the two Koreas and the U.S. come first, but we need the support and cooperation of the international community."( . . . .)President Moon was speaking at a reception at the Blue House for some 2-hundred Seoul-based ambassadors and representatives from international organizations -- the first such gathering since he took office.He also sought their support for the upcoming South Korea-ASEAN special summit set to take place in Busan next month, and the second P4G summit on climate change, which Korea will host next June.No sideline talks were arranged between Japanese ambassador Yasumasa Nagamine and the president, nor was there a direct message about the ongoing Seoul-Tokyo trade dispute.But President Moon did emphasize that international cooperation is required to revive the global economy through a fair and free trade order.
description: 한국을 대표하는 글로벌 방송! The World On Arirang!
